Meka, Indira, IG wrote:

>Hello,
>
>How do I make the tests not halt when there is an exception in the one
>of the asserts calls ( assertxpathexists) , but continue checking other
>paths?
>  
>
A unit test that has a failing assert of any kind is considered failed 
as a whole, so it is finished by throwing an AssertException. According 
to the makers of JUnit, there is no need to let the test continue after 
a failure, although other people disagree on that. Anyway, your problem 
can only be solved by splitting the test into more tests, preferably 
with one assertTrue (or another assert) per test.

-- 
  Mark Van Peteghem
